duties_responsibilities.duty: Design, develop, and support highly parallel and fault-tolerant database systems.
Introduce tools to facilitate greater automation and operability of services.
Utilize deep experience and problem-solving skills to help prevent and investigate production issues.
Create runtime tools/processes that optimize cloud triaging and limit downtime.
Define best practices around making systems and services measurable.
Work closely with various teams to ensure best practices are applied.
Maintain technical ownership and ensure concise collaboration with the technical leadership of other major parts of Snowflake.
Architect critical systems and anticipate strategic challenges and opportunities in key areas such as query processing, transaction management, or distributed data processing algorithms.
Own the production rollout of the features of the area while at the same time leveraging and growing other strong engineering talent in the team.
Evaluate and determine priorities with a critical understanding of where performance matters most.
Analyze and understand performance and scalability bottlenecks in the system and solve them.
Pinpoint problems, instrument relevant components as needed, and ultimately implement solutions.
Provide, improve, and translate a highly automated infrastructure pipeline for deploying and scaling a distributed, multi-tenant, high performance compute and data platform to new environments.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field (Master's preferred)
